summary.p: 53 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: E. H. 226; Qurʾānic Text: Q 11:52-12:52; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 240 x 350mm; Script style: ṯuluṯ; Date of production: 1282-83 CE.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 32: "98 E. H. 226. Cüz Aharlı ve vassaaleli krem rengi kâğıt. 350mm boy ve 240mm eninde 53 yaprak. Sahifede harekeli güzel sülüsle 118mm uzunluğunda 5 satır. Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī tarafından 681 (1282-83) de yazılmıştır. Duraklar ve cetveller yaldızlı. Miklepli sade siyah deri cilt. Bu cüzde Hūd (11) suresinin 52. ayetinden Yūsuf (12) suresinin 52. ayetine kadar yazılıdır."

This can be translated as follows: "98 E. H. 226. Juzʾ. Cream-colored sized paper with vaṣṣālī. 53 leaves of 350 mm height and 240 mm width. The text area written in an elegant thuluth with diacritics, [contains] 5 lines measuring 118 mm height. Copied by Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī in the year 681 (1282-83). The verse seperators and rule-borders are gilded. Simple black leather binding with flap (miklep). This juzʾ begins with Q 11:52 (Sūra Hūd) and ends with Q 12:52 (Sūra Yūsuf).”
